conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each inlet through the baffles.
Baffles are arranged to direct the flow of liquid from top to bottom.
Direction of the baffles is crucial in determining the path of the liquid.
Liquid from inlet A flows down the yellow baffle towards the left side.
Liquid from inlet A will likely flow into container E.
Liquid from inlet B flows down the green baffle towards the left side.
Liquid from inlet B will likely flow into container E.
Liquid from inlet C flows down the blue baffle towards the right side.
Liquid from inlet C will likely flow into container F.
Liquid from inlet D flows down the yellow baffle towards the right side.
Liquid from inlet D will likely flow into container F.
Inlets A and B direct the liquid into container E.
Inlets C and D direct the liquid into container F.
Container E will receive liquid from inlets A and B.
Container F will receive liquid from inlets C and D.
